original: Linderoth, Johan Gabriel (Elle) Hjalmar, redaktör, Uddevalla, f. 5/1/ 04 i Vetlanda av garverifabr. Johan Gustaf Hjalmar L. o. Eva Mathilda Carlsson. G. 34 m. Elsa Brita Amalia Ericson. — Realex. i Vetlanda 21. Res. t. Danm., Tyskl., Finl. o. Estl. Med-arb. i Hvetlanda Tidn. 23-24, Västerviks-Posten 24-29, Bohusläningen sedan 29, red :chef där sedan 46. Grundare av o. ordf. i Bohusläns lib. ungd:förb., sekr. i lib. ungd:förb. 32-34, ordf. i Uddevalla stads arb :-ilösh :nd, led. av stadsfuWm., drätsel-kamm., folksk :styr., fattigv :styr. o. deleg. f. socialv. i Uddevalla, sekr. i folkpart. lokalavd. sed. 33 o. styr. f. folkpart. i Bohusl. Medl. av Publ :kl. sed. 34. Sign.: L-th, E-e. Inneh. av G. H. v. Kochs stip. 42 o. Sv. Journ:-fören. 38.
translated: Linderoth, Johan Gabriel (Elle) Hjalmar, editor, Uddevalla, b. 5/1/04 in Vetlanda to tanner factory owner Johan Gustaf Hjalmar L. and Eva Mathilda Carlsson. Married in 1934 to Elsa Brita Amalia Ericson. Completed secondary education in Vetlanda in 1921. Traveled to Denmark, Germany, Finland, and Estonia. Worked as a collaborator for Hvetlanda Tidn. from 1923-1924, Västerviks-Posten from 1924-1929, and Bohusläningen since 1929. Became chief editor there in 1946. Founder and chairman of the Bohuslän liberal youth association, secretary of the liberal youth association from 1932-1934, chairman of the Uddevalla city labor commission, member of the city council, finance committee, school board, poor relief board, and delegate for social welfare in Uddevalla. Secretary of the local branch of the People's Party since 1933 and a member of the board for the People's Party in Bohuslän. Member of the Public Club since 1934. Signature: L-th, E-e. Recipient of G. H. v. Koch's scholarship in 1942 and a member of the Swedish Journalist Association since 1938.
